Summary I am currently based in London specialising in user interface design. I am passionate about the future of UI design and my writing on the trends in iOS design is featured in the top 50 'The Best of Medium'. I worked for the enterprise PIM startup Divide for two and a half years and we were acquired by Google in May where I have been working since. 
Previously, I spent the last six years working as destroywerk.com designing record covers for international bands, was featured in Creative Review twice and have created tutorials for both Computer Arts and Digital Arts magazines.  
I have lived in both Berlin and Buenos Aires for a year each where I worked with clients in different sectors and learnt from the experiences of other cultures. I also exhibited in both solo and group exhibitions such as the highly acclaimed ArteBA, South America's largest art fair. Summary Started out as User Interface Developer in the 80s at Bell Communications Research, and through Oracle, Aspect Telecommunications, Intraspect, Webvan, eBay, and finally Google, I've become nearly exclusively a User Interface Designer with some prototyping expertise. Recently, I am leading people and initiatives at Google, including team education and design pattern standardization. 
 
My goal is to positively affect the lives of as many people as I can with the work that I do, making life easier, more fun, and more satisfying. Summary I am passionate about creating and crafting delightful user experiences at pixel by pixel detail and how these experiences across products and devices interact with and take part in a larger eco-system. 
 
I have a keen interest in the space that exists in between technology and people and how might we design for the harmonies within this space today and in the future. 
 
It's not just about the product itself, it's also about the role and impact this product plays within it's environment and within our lives. 
 
Inspired by people, design and nature and how we might achieve harmonies between these as we create experiences through technology. Summary I am a Creative Director and visual design specialist originally from England. I design and create brand systems, interactive experiences and user interfaces for companies and agencies. I enjoy helping people to reimagine the visual story they are presenting. 
 
My client list has included Google, Adidas, Charles Schwab, Cisco, Hyundai, Sony, Blue Shield of California, New York Times and PayPal. 
 
My skill set includes creative direction, concept development, brand identity design, UX / user experience design, interactive design, UI / user interface design for digital, mobile and print. Areas of expertise include website design, mobile, interactive, digital campaigns, native apps, touchscreen experiences, brand exploration and pitch work.

Summary ► Are you looking for bespoke and effective UX design for your startup? 
► Are you a developer looking to partner with a well-rounded UX designer? 
 
I’m a UX/UI designer with extensive experience working with web developers and tech startups.  
My early career as a web designer equipped me with design and front-end coding skills which have helped me to become a well-rounded UX designer who has a deep understanding of the whole web development process. 
 
In addition to providing UX design as a service I have also developed a collection of design products. Some of these are top-sellers on the current marketplace.  
 
KEY STRENGTHS: 
 
► Efficient & Nimble 
I value efficiency highly and always strive for the most efficient way to do things. I’m a doer and I move fast to execute design ideas and evolve the design based on user feedback. I have the ability to cut through all the fluff and get right down to the core of the problem which makes me good at designing UX for complex and scalable web apps. 
 
► Empathetic 
I have empathy for people around me. I always try to put myself into other people’s shoes to understand their hopes, fears and desire. I’m fascinated with human psychology and believe it’s one of the most important ingredients in effective UX design. 
 
► Business-minded 
Through making, promoting and selling my own digital products, I’ve learned that merely having a good product is not enough. I’ve been an active practitioner of digital marketing/sales and this experience added another level of roundness to my UX skills which I think sets me apart from other UX designers.  
 
► Strong Work Ethic 
Coming from a Chinese background, I’m extremely grateful that my upbringing taught me about how important it is to have a strong work ethic and it is so hard-wired into me that working hard has become my lifestyle. 
 
If you are interested in my service please drop me an email. Let’s talk about how we can work together!

Summary I am a trained graphic, UI, UX, visual and interaction designer with over 10 years of agency and corporate experience. I have been primarily focused on web applications and interface design projects. I strongly believe in user experience design, it is what gives products its tactile feel and offers a physical point of engagement for users. Ideally, I would like a position working on mobile UX design; I strongly believe that this is quickly becoming the most tangible computing platform for the non-computing population. Great products can change the world, but great design will let the world use your products. 
 
Do you have a compelling problem that you're passionately solving? Tell me about it; maybe we can solve it together. 
 
Specialties: UI design, Web design, HTML, Flash design. Design production, Creative direction, Branding, Icon design, Print design, Interaction design

Summary I'm a 10+ year veteran to design. Starting as a web designer and programmer and moving to the more specialized areas of UX and UI design. As a practitioner of user-centered design I believe that user research and user testing are the backbone to any successful design methodology. 
 
I also think that usability, as a term, is a bit overused. To me, most micro-task usability has been pretty well figured out and patterned. You can follow certain design patterns and solutions and generally garner a great amount of usability. What I try to focus on equally are Usefulness and User Experience. Are the features engaging and useful? If they aren't, how can I compliment the functionality with purposeful design? And what is the overall experience the user has with the product? It's those 3 things: Usability, Usefulness and Experience that will make or break a product. A little luck and some good PR never hurts either. 
 
My experience with product design includes: consumer web applications, enterprise software for data-intensive business applications and I have roots in Flash with experimental navigation and interaction patterns. 
 
I think in Photoshop shortcut keys. Work briskly in Omnigraffle. Dig guerilla usability testing. Am teaching myself Ruby on Rails. Recently certified as an Agile Product Owner. Just won an Interactive Media Award (IMA 2010). Currently probably eating something.  
 
I'm always open to new ideas and new ventures -- shoot me a message. Specialties:Engineering Negotiations, Requirements Gathering, Contextual Inquiry, User Interviews, Mental Modeling, Heuristic Analysis, Card Sorting, Information Architecture, Whiteboarding with Product Management, Wireframing, Prototyping, Usefulness and Usability Testing, Visual Design, and Creating Specs and Style Guides.
